question.title: Spring boot application asking for a non-existent field
question.body:
I have no clue why Spring Boot IDE is asking this:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "java.util.ArrayList.add(Object)" because "this.account_holder_names" is null
    at Achul/admindashboard.sales.add_account_details(accounting.java:14)
    at Achul/admindashboard.accounting.main(accounting.java:56)

This is the source code:

package admindashboard;

import java.util.ArrayList;

class sales{
    ArrayList<String> account_holder_names;
    ArrayList<Long> sale_value;
    ArrayList<String> bank_account_numbers;
    ArrayList<String> regional_bank_codes;
    ArrayList<String> courses_sold;
    
    boolean add_account_details (String account_holder_name, long sale_amount, String bank_account_number_1, String bank_regional_code, String course_sold)
    {
        account_holder_names.add(account_holder_name);
        sale_value.add(sale_amount);
        bank_account_numbers.add(bank_account_number_1);
        regional_bank_codes.add(bank_regional_code);
        courses_sold.add(course_sold);
        
        return true;
    }

I renamed the project from Achul to ABCD according to the client's specification.

I saved the file before running the file.

I tried checking whether the statement required any such declarations. It did not.

I expected it to run since, there were no errors.

question_comments.body: "I expected it to run since, there were no errors." - I assume that you mean that there were no errors at compile / build time. Your expectation is ill-founded. Compile / build errors are not the only kind of errors that can occur. Indeed. the compiler CANNOT detect all possible sources / causes of errors in your code. (It is theoretically, and practically impossible.) This is why we have test frameworks (Junit, etc), debuggers and so on.
stackoverflow.com/questions/25385173/…, stackoverflow.com/questions/1592457/…
As @Fenio mentioned, you're not initializing your field. This is a typical case of a NullPointerException. See the duplicate to read more into the matter.
All of these array lists are not initialized. Add ` = new ArrayList<>();` to each of them. You can use add the method on non-initialized list
